com.appscend.media.events

Class APSMediaOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.appscend.media.APSMediaTrackableObject
      • com.appscend.media.events.APSMediaEvent
        • com.appscend.media.events.APSMediaOverlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class APSMediaOverlay
extends APSMediaEvent
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    APSMediaOverlay describes any overlay that the APSMediaPlayer instance needs to render during playback.
    Author:
    Appscend

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  APSMediaOverlay.APSMediaOverlayPosition
      Describes the position the overlay should take when placed on-screen by the player.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      APSMediaOverlay cloneOverlay()
      Creates a clone of the APSMediaOverlay object
      void computeDimensions()
      Compute overlay width and height
      void onPreload()
      This method will be invoked on a different thread by the player, before the event start point, as set by the preTriggerInterval field.
      void onTrigger()
      This code will be executed once the event is triggered by the player.
      void onUnload()
      This method will be invoked by the player once the event has reached the end point and will be deallocated.
      void onUpdate()
      This method will be invoked by the player periodically, giving the event the opportunity to respond to updated playback information.
      void removeOverlay(APSMediaOverlay overlay)

    • Field Detail

      • kAPSMetadataType

        public static final java.lang.String kAPSMetadataType
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • type

        public java.lang.String type

      • parameters

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters
        Overlay parameters. Implementation-specific to overlay controllers.

      • position

        public APSMediaOverlay.APSMediaOverlayPosition position

        Describes the position the overlay should take when placed on-screen by the player. APSMediaOverlayPosition for available values.

      • controller

        public APSMediaPlayerOverlayController controller
        A refence to the overlay controller object. This is set by the player, on the overlay's initial render.

      • zIndex

        public int zIndex
        The order of the overlay in the current view stack.

      • width

        public java.lang.String width
        The width of the overlay. Supports pixels (e.g.: "320") or percentages, relative to the total width (e.g.: "50%").

      • height

        public java.lang.String height
        The height of the overlay. Supports pixels (e.g.: "320") or percentages, relative to the total height (e.g.: "50%").

      • absoluteOffsetX

        public java.lang.String absoluteOffsetX
        The overlay's absolute horizontal offset in pixels, relative to the current origin. The current origin is determined by the overlay's position parameter, while the positive direction is always toward the center of the player surface.

      • absoluteOffsetY

        public java.lang.String absoluteOffsetY
        The overlay's absolute vertical offset in pixels, relative to the current origin. The current origin is determined by the overlay's position parameter, while the positive direction is always toward the center of the player surface.

      • fadeInDuration

        public float fadeInDuration
        The duration (in seconds) for the fade in effect of the overlay, when it is placed on and taken off screen.

      • repeatAfter

        public float repeatAfter
        If this parameter is greater than 0, then the overlay will be reshown by the media player after the specific time interval (in seconds).

      • shouldBeRemoved

        public boolean shouldBeRemoved

      • parentUnit

        public APSMediaUnit parentUnit

        After being added to a APSMediaUnit object, a reference to this parent can be found here.

      • metadata

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> metadata

        A HashMap containing the metadata associated with the overlay
